description: This is an overview of your organization's Windows Event Logs, as seen in Microsoft EventViewer. From here you can discover insights on event types, trends over time, user activity, and more.
title: Windows Event Log Overview

definition.content:
Monitor Windows Event Logs with this dashboard to gain better visibility into information on Windows hosts. 

Event Logs enhance your monitoring coverage by including crucial services that operate in the background, such as Windows Task Scheduler, Microsoft Defender, and Windows Firewall. Event logs confirm that these services are operating correctly (e.g., that your scheduled tasks have all properly executed) and provide more details into unexpected crashes or failures.

Windows Event logs also enable you to effectively monitor your organization’s security boundaries. Windows generates event logs for important security events, such as user logons, changes to access controls, and other audit activity that can signal attempts to breach your environment. 

Enable the Windows Event Log integration in your Datadog account to easily search, filter, and alert on all Windows events in Datadog.

For further reading, see:

- [Windows Event Log integration documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/win32_event_log/?tab=logs)
- [Monitor Windows Event Logs](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/monitor-windows-event-logs-with-datadog/)

Datadog Cloud SIEM analyzes and correlates Windows Event logs to detect threats to your environment in real time. If you don't see signals please make sure you've enabled [Datadog Cloud SIEM](https://app.datadoghq.com/security).
